bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, February 27, 1899
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D APR 3 '99 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: No. 20 Consular Series. Legation of the United States Monrovia Liberia, Feb'y. 27, 1899.
Owen L. W. Smith To Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.
Subject: An Official visitation to, and investigation of our Cape Coast Castle, Consular Agency.
No. 20, Consular Series. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, Feb'y 27, 1899.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington

Sir: I have the honor to transmit to you the intelligence, that according to my Nos 18 and 19, "Consular," of Jan. 30, 1899, I have made an official visit to, and made a personal investigation of the affairs of our Consular Agency at Cape Coast Castle. My report will accompany or follow this dispatch. I returned to Monrovia, in the afternoon of Feb'y 25, 1899. I have the honor to be
be your obedient servant, Owen L. W. Smith, M. R. and C. General
